text: The NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> subunit provides the transactivation activity in this complex and serves as an intracellular receptor for a cytoplasmic inhibitor of NF-kappa B , termed I kappa B .

In contrast , NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alone fails to stimulate kappa B - directed transcription , and based on prior in vitro studies , is not directly regulated by I kappa B . To investigate the molecular basis for the critical regulatory interaction between NF-kappa B and I kappa B / <extra_id_0> MAD-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a series of human NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutants was identified that functionally segregated DNA binding , I kappa B - mediated inhibition , and I kappa B - induced nuclear exclusion of this transcription factor .

Results from in vivo expression studies performed with these NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutants revealed the following : 1 ) I kappa B / <extra_id_0> MAD-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> completely inhibits NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent transcriptional activation mediated through the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 kappa B enhancer in human T lymphocytes , 2 ) the binding of I kappa B / <extra_id_0> MAD-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is sufficient to retarget NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> from the nucleus to the cytoplasm , 3 ) selective deletion of the functional nuclear localization signal present in the Rel homology domain of NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> disrupts its ability to engage I kappa B / <extra_id_0> MAD-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and 4 ) the unique C-terminus of NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> attenuates its own nuclear localization and contains sequences that are required for I kappa B - mediated inhibition of NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> DNA binding activity .

text: Together , these findings suggest that the nuclear localization signal and transactivation domain of NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> constitute a bipartite system that is critically involved in the inhibitory function of I kappa B / <extra_id_0> MAD-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
